comments.author: Yes, it's a NAME! (Carmen Ball)

comments.text:
Rubbish. You learn about alien hand syndrome in high school psychology. 
It's a symptom of the severing of the two sides of the brain (corpus 
callosum), so one side controls one hand, the other controls the other 
hand, but the two sides are not able to communicate so hence - Alien hand. ﻿

would be out of this world!﻿

comments.author: Darla Lathan

comments.text:
I have seen a lot of videos talking about how sex in zero G may be 
essential to human survival. I think that is not true. All it takes is a 
spinning space craft or a spinning section of a space craft to create 
sufficient gravity for humans to develop normally. So if we are rushed into 
space without designing a ship for long distance space travel then we may 
be in trouble. Lets face it, if we have to rush into space because of some 
unforeseen disaster then we are pretty much done anyway.  I personally do 
not think sex in zero g will ever be necessary.  ﻿

comments.author: Lenard Villaflor

comments.text:
Actually, I studied psychology at A level, so I did learn about 'alien hand 
syndrome'-commonly a result of the corpus callosum being severed during 
'split brain surgery' (in lay man's terms.) Often used for highly epileptic 
patients, since it helps to stop seizures spreading across the brain. AHS 
is generally caused when the two hemispheres are both fighting to be 
dominant.﻿
